intro: Tephroseris longifolia subsp. moravica, commonly known as the Moravian longleaf tephroseris, is a flowering plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The subspecies is distinguished by its elongated, slender leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, calcareous soils in forested or shaded habitats. This plant is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
